abstract: Goldman Sachs says its assets on its balance sheet have grown by 7.6 percent since the end of 2008. Does that mean financial reform isn’t working?
snippet: Goldman Sachs says its assets on its balance sheet have grown by 7.6 percent since the end of 2008. Does that mean financial reform isn’t working?
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs is still growing. Does that mean financial reform is proving a big fail on the too big to fail question?

headline.main: When Too Big to Fail Gets Bigger

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
